main event: A witness observed a bright light in the sky while driving along a highway in Barbourville, Kentucky on March 23, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of 200-300 miles and was moving at speeds of 25,000-30,000 mph., The object was described as self-luminous and located in the northwest at a 25 degree elevation., The motion of the object was not extreme, suggesting it could be followed by the observer's equipment., There is speculation that the object observed could have been Venus due to its distance and appearance., The sighting was documented in a Project Blue Book record card.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: a civilian driving along a highway
